intro: Achillea genipi, commonly known as the Alpine yarrow, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, preferring well-drained soils and full sun exposure. Its flowers are small and white to pale yellow, arranged in flat-topped clusters, and bloom from late spring to early summer. Achillea genipi is valued for its ornamental appeal and historical use in traditional medicine.
